actions.text: Amendment SA 928, under the order of 11/8/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 56. Record Vote Number: 202.
Amendment SA 928 proposed by Senator McCain to Amendment SA 927. (consideration: CR S7267-7268) To provide American jobs through economic growth.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 928, under the order of 11/8/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 56. Record Vote Number: 202.

Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 928, under the order of 11/8/2011, not having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 56. Record Vote Number: 202.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 928 proposed by Senator McCain to Amendment SA 927.

amends_amendment.purpose: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permit a 100 percent levy for payments to Federal vendors relating to property, to require a study on how to reduce the amount of Federal taxes owed but not paid by Federal contractors, and to make certain improvements in the laws relating to the employment and training of veterans.

purpose: To provide American jobs through economic growth.
